pullRequest.title: fix: Generated schemas contains a valid meta-schema URI reference
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description
fix #2519: Generated schemas contains a valid meta-schema URI reference (http://json-schema.org/draft-05/schema#)

Improved model generation script (peforms gobuild by default > no mvn)
Fixed problem with kubernetes-model-events generation
Fixed problem with chaosmesh model generation (invalid go module indirect reference)
Removed no longer generated/maintained kube-validation-schema.json
Added 5.x Migration guide

Type of change


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 Feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change
 Chore (non-breaking change which doesn't affect codebase;
test, version modification, documentation, etc.)

Checklist

 Code contributed by me aligns with current project license: Apache 2.0
 I Added CHANGELOG entry regarding this change
[ ] I have implemented unit tests to cover my changes
 I have added/updated the javadocs and other documentation accordingly
 No new bugs, code smells, etc. in SonarCloud report
 I tested my code in Kubernetes
 I tested my code in OpenShift

commit.message:
fix: Generated schemas contains a valid meta-schema URI reference (`http://json-schema.org/draft-05/schema#`)

 - Improved model generation script (peforms gobuild by default > no mvn)
 - Fixed problem with kubernetes-model-events generation
 - Fixed problem with chaosmesh model generation (invalid go module indirect reference)
 - Removed no longer generated/maintained kube-validation-schema.json
 - Added 5.x Migration guide

nodes.bodyText: Why this migration guide doesn't provide information about Doneable being removed and change in edit() signatures? Or does this PR only document it from the model perspective?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,6 @@
+# Migration from 4.x to 5.x
+
+## kube-validation-schema.json files renamed to validation-schema.json
